isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Diagnostic Software Operation - Diagnostic Tests - Key-On Engine-Running Tests

svcsubproc.title: Standard Test

note.para: The KOER Standard test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.

svcsubproc.para: During the KOER Standard test, the ECM commands the IPR through a step test to determine if the ICP system is performing as expected. The ECM monitors signal values from the ICP sensor and compares those values to the expected values. When the Standard test is done, the ECM returns the engine to the normal operation and transmits DTCs set during the test.

note.para: Before doing this test, confirm the following conditions:

item.para: Problems causing active DTCs were corrected, and active DTCs were cleared.
Engine coolant temperature must be at least 70 °C (158 °F).
Battery voltage must be higher than 10.5 volts.

step1.para: With the engine running, select D_KOER_Standard.ssn from the Open Session File window, select Open to open the session.
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Running Tests from the drop down menu.
From the KOER Diagnostics menu, select Standard and select Run to start the test.

svcsubproc.para: The ECM increases engine idle to a predetermined value and commands the IPR valve to set ICP to rated speed pressure. If the performance of the ICP system is acceptable, the ECM will control the IPR valve and reduce the pressure in steps, while continuing to monitor the ICP system.
When the test is done, the ECM restores normal engine operation, and the Diagnostics Trouble Code window will display DTCs, if there are problems.

step1.para: Correct problem causing active DTCs.
Clear DTCs.
When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.

svcsubproc.title: Continuous Monitor Test

note.para: This test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Continuous Monitor test troubleshoots intermittent connections at sensors and actuators. The engine can be off or running.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, use care to prevent contact with the door edge when the cab is up and the door is open.

step1.para: Select D_ContinuousMonitor.ssn from the Open Session File window, select Open to open the session.
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Running tests from the drop down menu.
From the KOER Diagnostics menu, select Continuous Monitor and select Run to start the test.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, be careful around rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Wiggle connectors and wires at all suspected problem locations. If circuit continuity is interrupted, the EST will display DTCs related to the condition.
Correct problem causing active DTCs.
Clear DTCs.
When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

svcsubproc.title: Air Management Test

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.
The Air Management test can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required. The Standard test must be done before doing the Air Management test.

svcsubproc.para: The Air Management test checks the operation of the Air Management System and the Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) valve.
During the Air Management test, the ECM commands the EGR actuator through a step test sequence, to determine if the valve is performing as expected.
If a fault is detected the test will end, engine operation will return to normal, and a DTC will be set.
If a fault is not detected the test will be completed and engine operation will return to normal.

step1.para: With the engine running, select D_KOER_AirManagement_V6.ssn from the Open Session File window, select Open to open the session..
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Running Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From KOER Diagnostics menu, select Air Management and select Run to start the test.
Correct problem causing active DTCs.
Clear DTCs.
When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

figure.caption: Air Management diagnostic readout for engine rpm, EGR position, and MAF

svcsubproc.para: The ECM commands the EGR valve to close and increases the engine idle speed to 900 rpm. The ECM allows the Manifold Air Flow (MAF) to stabilize. The ECM monitors and compares the MAF to the expected values; flow is expected to increase. If the MAF does not exceed the expected flow or there is a MAF sensor fault, the test is cancelled and "Engine Not In Testing Range" is displayed.

The ECM commands the EGR valve to open, and allows MAF to stabilize. The ECM monitors MAF and compares it to the expected flow; flow is expected to decrease. If the MAF is not below the expected flow, DTC 346 is set and the test is cancelled.

The ECM commands the EGR valve to close, and allows MAF to stabilize. The ECM monitors MAF and compares it to the expected flow; flow is expected to increase. If the MAF does not exceed the expected flow, DTC 346 is set and the test is cancelled.
The ECM returns engine speed to low idle. If all flow comparisons meet requirements, no DTC is set and the engine is returned to normal operation.
